docs.text: dead-bang , an action thriller starring don johnson , lives up to its dumb title , or at least to half of it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although dead-bang is definitely dead , it is anything but a bang ; in fact , they should have called this one " dead bore . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the film , johnson plays . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you guessed it . . .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a cop .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the role must have been really challenging for johnson since his character , jerry beck , is a gritty los angeles homicide detective , a real stretch from the slick vice detective johnson portrayed on " miami vice . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a la mel gibson in lethal weapon , beck is an emotional wreck , complete with violent outbursts , unscrupulous police methods , and a bleak outlook on life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: beck's wife has just divorced him , and she is cutting him off from their children .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she will not even allow him to wish them " merry christmas " by telephone .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but beck's family and emotional problems take a back seat to the action and thrills in dead-bang .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: beck is investigating the brutal murders of a shopkeeper and a cop .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his investigation starts in l . a . and finally culminates and climaxes in oklahoma , where he has a violent showdown with the killers at a white supremacist camp .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: virtually every aspect of dead-bang is inept and ineffective .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot is incoherent and full of holes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie depicts beck's investigation so clumsily that you never see the connections between his clues and his conclusions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the action sequences in dead-bang are strictly third-rate , and the movie has absolutely no momentum or suspense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i certainly expected more from long-time director john frankenheimer who directed the classic political thriller , the manchurian candidate--as well as black sunday , seven days in may , and the french connection ii .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in all fairness to frankenheimer , however , i should note that most of dead-bang's shortcomings seem to stem from its shabby script rather than from the direction .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: dead-bang tries to don a mask of social relevance by incorporating themes of racism and white supremacy , but its efforts are nothing more than token gestures and nothing less than insulting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: according to the movie's production notes , dead-bang is based on the real-life experiences of still-active detective jerry beck .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you would never guess this from watching dead-bang , however , since the film totally lacks credibility ; it is utterly unconvincing and unbelievable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of the characters in dead-bang are either atrociously acted , underdeveloped , superfluous , or all of the above .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: william forsythe , for example , is painfully bad as arthur kressler , a wholesome by-the-book fbi agent who's offended by beck's foul language and unorthodox methods .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: forsythe's lame performance and corny dialogue makes his character unbearable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: dead-bang marks the motion picture debut of tim reid ( " wkrp in cincinnati " and " frank's place " ) , but his talents are completely wasted in a cliched and contrived role ; he plays the chief officer of a squadron of black cops who help beck to nail the villains .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the sole function of penelope ann miller's character is to give dead-bang an excuse to include a gratuitous love scene between characters about whom you could not care less .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i guess the film's title refers to this love scene since it's definitely a dead bang .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the only real virtue of dead-bang , believe it or not , is don johnson , who tries to overcome the limitations of the movie's pitiful script .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: johnson succeeds in giving his character a sarcastic sense of humor and a hint of depth , and his pessimistic wisecracks occasionally bring the film to life .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and i must admit that dead-bang does have one or two amusing moments .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the funniest scene has johnson throwing-up all over a criminal as he interrogates him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but when barf is the highlight of a movie , you know the movie's in trouble .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the other amusing scene involves a psychological examination of beck , in which he can't keep a straight face because the psychiatrist resembles woody allen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but two funny scenes and a couple good wisecracks do not a movie make .
docs.label: negative
